Package net.viktorc.pp4j.impl

Class ProcessPoolExecutor

  • Object
    • ProcessPoolExecutor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ProcessExecutor, ProcessExecutorService
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    JavaProcessPoolExecutor
    public class ProcessPoolExecutor
extends Object
implements ProcessExecutorService
    An implementation of the ProcessExecutorService interface for maintaining and managing a pool of process executors. The processes executors are instances of an internal ProcessExecutor implementation. Each executor is assigned an ProcessManager instance provided by the pool's ProcessManagerFactory instance. The pool accepts submissions in the form of Submission instances which are executed in any one of the available active process executors maintained by the pool. While executing a submission, the same executor cannot accept further submissions. The submissions are queued and executed as soon as there is an available executor. The size of the pool is always kept between the minimum pool size and the maximum pool size (both inclusive). The reserve size specifies the minimum number of processes executors that should always be available (there are no guarantees that there actually will be this many available executors at any given time). This class uses SLF4J for logging.
    Author:
    Viktor Csomor

    • Constructor Detail

      • ProcessPoolExecutor

        public ProcessPoolExecutor​(ProcessManagerFactory processManagerFactory,
                           int minPoolSize,
                           int maxPoolSize,
                           int reserveSize,
                           long threadKeepAliveTime)
                    throws InterruptedException
        Constructs a pool of processes. The initial size of the pool is the minimum pool size or the reserve size depending on which one is greater. This constructor blocks until the initial number of processes start up. The size of the pool is dynamically adjusted based on the pool parameters and the rate of incoming submissions.
        Parameters:
        processManagerFactory - A ProcessManagerFactory instance that is used to build ProcessManager instances that manage the processes' life cycle in the pool.
        minPoolSize - The minimum size of the process pool.
        maxPoolSize - The maximum size of the process pool.
        reserveSize - The number of available processes to keep in the pool.
        threadKeepAliveTime - The number of milliseconds of idleness after which threads are terminated if the sizes of the thread pools exceed their core sizes.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - If the thread is interrupted while it is waiting for the core threads to start up.
        IllegalArgumentException - If the manager factory is null, or the minimum pool size is less than 0, or the maximum pool size is less than the minimum pool size or 1, or the reserve size is less than 0 or greater than the maximum pool size.

      • ProcessPoolExecutor

        public ProcessPoolExecutor​(ProcessManagerFactory processManagerFactory,
                           int minPoolSize,
                           int maxPoolSize,
                           int reserveSize)
                    throws InterruptedException
        Constructs a pool of processes. The initial size of the pool is the minimum pool size or the reserve size depending on which one is greater. This constructor blocks until the initial number of processes start up. The size of the pool is dynamically adjusted based on the pool parameters and the rate of incoming submissions.
        Parameters:
        processManagerFactory - A ProcessManagerFactory instance that is used to build ProcessManager instances that manage the processes' life cycle in the pool.
        minPoolSize - The minimum size of the process pool.
        maxPoolSize - The maximum size of the process pool.
        reserveSize - The number of available processes to keep in the pool.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - If the thread is interrupted while it is waiting for the core threads to start up.
        IllegalArgumentException - If the manager factory is null, or the minimum pool size is less than 0, or the maximum pool size is less than the minimum pool size or 1, or the reserve size is less than 0 or greater than the maximum pool size.

      • execute

        public void execute​(Submission<?> submission)
             throws FailedCommandException,
                    DisruptedExecutionException
        Description copied from interface: ProcessExecutor
        It has the process sequentially execute the commands contained in the submission and blocks until the execution of every command is complete. The result of the submission, if there is one, can be subsequently accessed by calling the Submission.getResult() method.
        Specified by:
        execute in interface ProcessExecutor
        Parameters:
        submission - The submission to execute.
        Throws:
        FailedCommandException - If one of the submission's commands fails.
        DisruptedExecutionException - If the executor is stopped before it could complete the execution of the submission, or if there is any other error unrelated to the submission that leaves the execution of the submission incomplete. Implementations of ProcessExecutor are encouraged to terminate the executor when throwing this exception.

      • submit

        public <T> Future<T> submit​(Submission<T> submission,
                            boolean terminateProcessAfterwards)
        Description copied from interface: ProcessExecutorService
        Submits the specified submission for execution and returns a Future instance which allows for the cancellation of the submission. It does not block until the submission is processed. The termination of the executing process after the execution may be requested.
        Specified by:
        submit in interface ProcessExecutorService
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type variable of the submission.
        Parameters:
        submission - The submission to execute.
        terminateProcessAfterwards - Whether the process to which the submission is delegated should be terminated after the execution of the submission.
        Returns:
        A Future instance representing the pending completion of the task.

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Description copied from interface: ProcessExecutorService
        Initiates the orderly shutdown of the process pool. It does not affect the execution of previously submitted tasks. See ExecutorService.shutdown().
        Specified by:
        shutdown in interface ProcessExecutorService

      • forceShutdown

        public List<Submission<?>> forceShutdown()
        Description copied from interface: ProcessExecutorService
        Initiates the shutdown of the process pool discarding all submissions waiting for execution. It returns the list of the submissions waiting for execution in the submission queue and clears the queue. It does not interrupt the execution of submissions already taken off the submission queue by process executors. It mimics ExecutorService.shutdownNow() in behaviour with the difference that process executors are not interrupted. To do so, the list of submissions returned by this method can be used to resolve which submissions are still executing and the execution of those submissions may be interrupted by cancelling their corresponding Future instances returned by the pool with mayInterruptIfRunning set to true.
        Specified by:
        forceShutdown in interface ProcessExecutorService
        Returns:
        A list of the submissions that were awaiting execution.

      • isShutdown

        public boolean isShutdown()
        Description copied from interface: ProcessExecutorService
        Returns whether the shutdown of the pool has been initiated. See ExecutorService.isShutdown().
        Specified by:

        Returns:
        Whether the shutdown of the pool has been initiated.

      • isTerminated

        public boolean isTerminated()
        Description copied from interface: ProcessExecutorService
        Returns whether the process pool has been shut down with all its processes terminated. See ExecutorService.isTerminated().
        Specified by:
        isTerminated in interface ProcessExecutorService
        Returns:
        Whether all the processes of the pool have terminated.

      • awaitTermination

        public boolean awaitTermination​(long timeout,
                                TimeUnit unit)
                         throws InterruptedException
        Description copied from interface: ProcessExecutorService
        It blocks until the ProcessExecutorService.isTerminated() method returns true or a timeout occurs. See ExecutorService.awaitTermination(long, TimeUnit).
        Specified by:
        awaitTermination in interface ProcessExecutorService
        Parameters:
        timeout - The amount of time to wait for the pool's termination.
        unit - The unit of that amount.
        Returns:
        Whether the pool has successfully terminated or a timeout occurred.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - If the thread is interrupted while the method is blocking.
